programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when a notorious terrorist sets off a bomb on Philippine Airlines Flight 434, leaving one dead and 10 injured.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The ten most life-threatening hunts undertaken by the Louisiana hunters.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the teams pursues a gator that has been preying on cattle, while another bunch of swampers is faced with catches that are too big to get in the boat.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: VP Express boss Hugh Rowland carries a huge car crusher to St Theresa Point. One of the heaviest of the season, the load scrapes a trail all the way to the remote outpost, riding just 10 inches above the ground. Tired of waiting for Polar Industries to provide him with loads, Darrell decides to take matters into his own hands. Finding a local with a truck to rent, he decides to go it alone and see how many loads he can snaffle from under Polar's nose. His defection leads to further tension in the Polar ranks.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Temperatures are on the rise and the ice roads begin to crack, leaving the truckers with a race against time to make sure their rigs and cargo do not sink into the freezing waters. Lisa and Todd tackle a completely untouched route to Polar Hill, one of the most remote destinations on the winter roads, and Art's job is on the line following some stern words from boss Mark.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank examine petrol station advertising and memorabilia, and stumble on an exciting piece of motoring history.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic cycling gold-medallist Chris Hoy, impressionist Ronni Ancona, writer and producer Danny Wallace and sports presenter Gabby Logan join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Felicity Ward, Sue Perkins and Alex Brooker are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Josh gets dumped by his girlfriend, so Owen takes him on a double date with a couple of voracious older women. Meanwhile, an e-mail mix-up leads to Kate breaking Geoff's heart. Sitcom, co-written by and starring Josh Widdicombe, with Elis James, Beattie Edmondson and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The historical importance of freight trains, including four-mile long vehicles transporting enough iron ore to build two Eiffel towers.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: dinnerladies diaries
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of how the British sitcom was made, featuring unseen footage of Victoria Wood, and interviews with the cast as they reminisce about the show.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Norman the breadman fails to deliver, the stripper cannot play the accordion and Jean has bridesmaids' knickers on her mind. First episode of the canteen comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Julie Walters and Celia Imrie.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff await an important royal visit, but first Stan has to pick just the right toupee, and Bren is determined to get the tables cleared away in time. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren's mother wreaks havoc in the factory and incurs Stan's wrath by pursuing an ill-considered romance, while Anita organises a heated debate on the workers' current situation. Comedy, with Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: How to Ignite Your Errand Boy
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright has a rival for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's attention, as a visitor from Australia - and an old flame of hers- returns to his old stomping ground.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Ross has his contact book stolen by a woman he brought home from the pub, and the next morning one of his informants is found murdered, with the word 'grass' daubed in red paint at the scene of the crime. The heat is on for the inspector as he realises he has to come clean about what happened - and the pressure increases when someone else mentioned in the book is found dead. John Michie stars.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Two further bodies and a skeleton are found at the former boarding house and Walker isn't convinced that the alibi of former guest Graham Richards is enough.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Tom Cadman discovers that his wife has been having an affair with a rival officer whilst he has been in Norther Ireland.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The fusiliers are brought in to collect rubbish due to a national strike, and CSM Chick Henwood finds his loyalties tested as his brother is one of the strikers.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: At the End of a Long Day
programme.desc: Yvonne sets off for Barton Street Station to face formal manslaughter charges but has a run-in with a drunk en route and ends up hitting him - which won't exactly count in her favour when she appears in court. Jo Masters discovers one of Phil's informants is dealing in drugs with the collusion of a crooked customs officer, while Roger and Dan find a missing schoolgirl in woodlands and realise she has just given birth - but can't see any sign of her baby.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Elliot's wife needs treatment when her tracheotomy becomes infected, but when Connie tries to help she finds there is no record of the previous operation in Gina's notes. Kyla's former husband visits the hospital, determined to spend time with their son, and one of Sam's patients puts Marcia in an awkward position.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Barney faces a life-or-death dilemma, Penny's medical skills are tested to the limit during a diving course, and Holly is mystified at the collapse of a promising teenage dancer. Medical drama, starring Donna Alexander, Ronnie McCann and Una Stubbs.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser arrives at Sun Hill, where she makes a good impression on Jo Masters and Phil Hunter. Zain discovers Smithy is sleeping with Louise Larson, and warns him the consequences could be deadly if her husband finds out. June is forced to deal with a date-rape case on her first day back at work, while Yvonne resolves to admit she assaulted a drunk the night before - but reckons without Honey and Tony, who talk her out of it and destroy CCTV evidence of the attack.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There's a rift in the family dynamics between Meena, Sanjay & Gita after the death of their mother and Arthur makes a big decision about his life in the square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Beth returns to Nigel, but will he forgive and forget or is his broken heart damaged beyond repair and Michelle's secret is out, thanks to Mandy, how will everyone react?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bayleaf reassesses his future with the force, and Nick is pressured into making a tough decision. The brigade are called to help a man is being held hostage in a car.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Donald and Ewan's fishing trip inadvertently brings a long-buried secret to light with the discovery of a lost German fighter plane in the loch. Isobel knows her godfather, local butcher Irvine Taylor, was the pilot and resolves to keep everyone else in the dark - but an MoD investigation threatens to scupper her plans. Elsewhere, Molly is devastated to learn she has a heart condition and a lonely Jess unwittingly agrees to take part in a karaoke competition with Ewan.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The new head of the primary school upsets Beth by suggesting that a much-loved teacher's erratic behaviour may be down to a drinking problem, but when pupils are put at risk the nurse realises there could be an even more serious explanation. Meanwhile, the Scorpions face a difficult match and Anna fears she's jeopardised the factory's future when she gives an unhelpful bank manager a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Patrick searches for his father, while Stephen aspires to be a celebrity.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy feels the need to do something special for the Queen's Silver Jubilee so he volunteers himself, Clegg, and Compo to help with the town's pageant. However, the need arises to find someone capable of driving a tractor. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo are called to an unusual crime scene, where archaeologists searching for an ancient burial site are in conflict with builders working on a bypass. The investigation suffers a setback when a fight between the two factions destroys all the evidence. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra reopens an investigation into the suspected suicide of a Foreign Office diplomat, whose body was found in a frozen London lake after she had suffered the personal tragedy of a miscarriage and the professional embarrassment of having a government laptop stolen from her home. The woman's fiance and twin sister both believe her death is connected to sensitive information held on the missing computer and blame her boss for her downfall - and when Sandra clashes with the man himself, it only makes her more determined to pursue the conspiracy theory, despite Strickland's advice to tread carefully. Simon Day and Sharon Small guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Dr Sam Ryan discovers evidence of physical violence on the body of a girl who supposedly drowned accidentally. Once the child's disturbing family history is known, headstrong Ryan defies police chiefs and sets out on a murder investigation. Drama, starring Amanda Burton, with Lesley Dunlop and Carl Hillsden.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Actress and model Charlie Brooks joins the panel to discuss her work campaigning to make the internet a safer place for young people to use and enjoy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Andover answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a new garden for an eight-year-old girl in Nottingham, despite the worst weather they have ever experienced. Tilly Sawford was severely scalded in a freak accident six years ago and continues to require treatment to aid her recovery, leading to the staff at her local hospital recommending the family have a safe garden created for them, with a bold colour scheme and surprise areas for all of the children.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Alone, heavily pregnant and fed up with life, Mel faces having to go through the birth of her first child without the married father of her baby, who has chosen to stay with his wife and family. She is without even her own family, who have given her the cold shoulder. Sheridan Smith stars in the first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: David Collins is unexpectedly acquitted on a technicality having served seven years of a life sentence for the murder of his wife Tara. On the steps of the court, he vows to bring to book those who lied at his original trial, to see the real killer jailed and more importantly, to regain custody of his two young children. Drama, starring Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1987 FA Cup Final: Coventry v Tottenham - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.desc: We take a look back at all the best number 1's from your favourite boys in music! Data supplied by The OCC.

programme.title: UK HOTLIST Top 20
programme.desc: We count down the UK's most-streamed tracks of the week, as compiled by Spotify.

programme.title: Buzzin' With Big Hits
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits around from the biggest artists on the planet, right here, right now.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Tension grow among the crew after a rash move by Farley leaves him broken and bedridden, and morale sinks even lower via equipment failure, and a beached boat.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: What seems to be the face of Christ is found in a field in Hungary, and a sinister shape spotted in the mountains of Afghanistan leads investigators to a hidden atrocity.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a customised bike for Klipsch Audio Technologies, but staffing problems force Paul Teutul Sr to redouble his search for new employeess.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the technology behind the world's most powerful vessels, planes and trains. In the first edition, five colossal ships are compared to one another.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike begins the day with a look at a Mardi Gras float. He then has the unenviable task of assembling cow bladders that will be used during the parade to drive away evil spirits.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of powder horns, hand-crafted moulds, pierogies and inner tubes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Where materials come from and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years, featuring lace, antique frame replicas, orchids and unicycle wheel hubs.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction process behind the creation of the reinvented Morgan three-wheeler. Plus, the making of flame-retardant materials that help protect firefighters from burns.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tensions rise on board the Northwestern, and a Wizard deckhand falls asleep at the wheel, placing the boat on a collision course with nearby vessels.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Amanda Bichard wants to prove she's more than a pretty face in a male-dominated profession, determined to make it as an abalone diver. Veteran diver David 'Bucky' Buckland has leased a new boat, but it has not arrived and his debt is escalating.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Maserati 3200 GT for under 10,000, but he suspects it is going to cost a lot of money to complete a successful makeover as problems include wayward handling, a hair-trigger throttle and a faulty air-conditioning system.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a part-restored Camaro in California with its fair share of problems. Can he and Edd work their magic and make a profit on the project?.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini heads to Greenwich, Connecticut, where he views the vehicles being offered for sale at the Bonhams auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tracks down a Porsche for restoration, but after seeing the elements of an impressive car collection, he may have trouble letting it go.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do planes take off and land on a beach at one of the world's oldest airports? And, how do they hand-make the national dress of Bavaria, lederhosen?.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they catch the world's largest lobsters? How do they build the iconic chesterfield sofa? And, how do they capture the world's sharpest TV pictures?.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Winter storms are set to rage, which could halt all diving for weeks, and the crews have to find new ways to keep the abalone coming in and secure their income.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A mutiny transpires on the Cornelia Marie in the middle of a rough king crab season, while mental and physical breakdowns plague the crew of the Kodiak.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Finland looking for props, including Cold War Russian anti-aircraft guns, for a new blockbuster movie.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Devon, Drew Pritchard rummages through a heap railway items collected over 30 years by a local enthusiast. He then digs out treasure at a recently closed glove factory in Yeovil.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The sudden collapse of a motorway bridge in Scotland, Plus, a 1970s care home in York is razed to the ground - but precious Roman remains lie just below the surface.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Devon mansion and takes home the worst chair he has ever bought and, at a lace factory in Scotland, literally goes home with the kitchen sink.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard does battle at a castle in Essex, drives a hard bargain on automobile memorabilia, and an antiques emporium in Berkshire holds anatomical interest.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Sig tries to offload his crab before saving his gear, Casey shows Josh what it means to be a captain, and the polar ice descends, threatening the end of the season.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technological processes involved in making car batteries and toothbrushes. Plus, the method used to convert cacao beans into chocolate.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in maintaining the Eiffel Tower, and how chrome is polished to make it extra shiny.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins revamping an old Range Rover bought by Mike Brewer, but problems soon arise when the vehicle's CO2 emissions are tested.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China adds the finishing touches to the newly transformed Range Rover, and Mike Brewer takes the vehicle out for a test drive before putting it up for sale.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How tiny shreds of evidence can be crucial in proving the guilt or innocence of suspects, focusing on the murders committed by David Middleton and the killings of Bunchee Nyhuis and Jeffrey Russell.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The 2014 murder of Jessica Padgett, who was last seen on surveillance cameras driving into a car parking space and walking down an alley.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of an armoured van suggests professional crooks are at work - but two of the perpetrators are discovered to be former law enforcement personnel.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A team of investigators discovers a household that is overrun by cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Visiting the bridal salon today are Dale, who has been waiting 30 years for her dream wedding, and Rachael, who wants to find a princess dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop, while another customer seeks to combine the styles of Audrey Hepburn and Joan Jett.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Designer Henry Roth wants to provide a customer with a perfect gown, while another bride brings her wedding planner to her fitting.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two boxer puppies are found wandering the streets, and Dr Chris Brown tries to save one after it is hit by a car and begins to cough up blood.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and the team hope a miniature horse suffering from dwarfism disease will survive another major operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two girls wait anxiously as Dr Chris Brown works to save their rabbit.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An Australian kelpie is brought to the surgery after a knock to its head causes severe difficulties with balancing, and a brain scan reveals the problems are inoperable.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief Investigator Boller visits a livestock auction, where he rescues horses from slaughter by outbidding buyers from meat markets.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A horse with overgrown teeth is seized, and an elderly woman hides her dogs from investigators.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, with no finger prints at the scene, detectives turned to cutting-edge forensic techniques to track a callous killer, hoping to land their man before he could strike again.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Bethany Decker, a National Guardsman's wife, who vanished while pregnant with her second child as her husband completed a tour of service in Afghanistan. Police discovered the 21-year-old's life was far more complicated than anyone realised.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 27-year-old Tracy Ocasio, who went missing from West Orlando, Florida, in May 2009. On the night of her disappearance she was seen in the company of a man currently serving a life sentence for the attempted murder of another woman. When one of her boots was found in woodland detectives searched the area, but no body was recovered.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: In 2004, a 31-year-old nurse died suddenly of kidney failure. When detectives looked into the affairs of her overly grieving husband, they discovered a web of lies and forgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: An interfering mother of the bride makes things difficult for Diane, while Keesha gets good news about the lump she found in her breast.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who is renewing her wedding vows brings her two sons with her to choose her dress, but struggles when they do not approve of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rochelle brings her family over from California to help her choose her dress, including her opinionated father, and a girl finds it difficult to stay within her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Chaos hits the store with the launch of the annual sale, as queues form outside the building and the owner breaks his own strict rules.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store's buyers head to Bridal Market Week, a crucial event where designers showcase their latest trends, while Sarah helps an Islamic bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kleinfeld's welcomes a variety of clients, from a bride with a liking for vintage fashion, to a biker chick with more outlandish tastes.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors spend a day at a market in Sommieres with expert dealer Mark Franks. Back in the UK, they upcycle their items before selling their wares in Winchester.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Rena and Lee's Story - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Since meeting at a bariatric rehab centre in 2006, Lee and Rena's weight has skyrocketed. The couple are now taking a second attempt to save their lives.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: A look back at the major events of Meri's time with the family, as she prepares to make a decision that could change the lives of her fellow wives.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Cameras observe the model, businesswoman and celebrity's life in an access-all-areas pass into her relationships with family and friends, at work and at play.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The case of teenager Shaun Ouillette. The night after she vanished an anonymous letter led detectives into the frozen woods, where they made a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Exploring the mind of an obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the often confused workings of the criminal psyche.
